details.location: Asia Pacific University, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
details.description: Google Cloud Platform Next 2016 Kuala Lumpur is a full day event of workshops and talks centered around the latest developments in cloud technology. There will be talks and workshops conduct by Google Developer Experts and industry experts.
details.get-ticket: Get your ticket now on Peatix

getting.title: Getting there
getting.event_name: Google Cloud Platform Next Extended 2016 Kuala Lumpur
getting.getting_description: We are hosting Google Cloud Platform Next Extended 2016 Kuala Lumpur at the Asia Pacific University, Kuala Lumpur.
getting.there-are-ways: There are few ways to come to

getting_method.method_description: If you are coming to APU by LRT, get off at the Bukit Jalil LRT station on the Sri Petaling Line. From the Bukit Jalil LRT station, it is a short cab ride to APU’s main campus (approx. RM 5 – RM 7)

If you are coming to APU by taxi, just inform the taxi driver that you need to be taken to 'Technology Park Malaysia' in Bukit Jalil. Once you are inside Technology Park, you will see boards that will point you to APU’s main campus. If you are using Grabcar simply search for, 'APIIT TPM'
If you are driving please find the location below:

resources.title: Resources
resources.resources_description: Sharing is caring. Here are some useful resources you might like it

resources_details.title: Cloud Vision API Codelabs
resources_details.desc: In this codelab, you will create a “PokeDex”-like application that allows you to take photos of any object, and the application will provide descriptive words about the photo using the Google Cloud Vision API.

resources_details.title: Android Cloud Testing Codelabs
resources_details.desc: In this codelab, you’ll learn how to get started with using Cloud Test Lab for testing your mobile apps. You’ll be able to run your tests from the web, Android studio, or using our “gcloud” command line interface. You can even integrate it to your Continuous Integration environment.

resources_details.title: Firebase Codelabs (Chat App)
resources_details.desc: In this codelab, you’ll learn how to use the plain Javascript (without any framework and backend!) to create a Chat app using Firebase.

resources_details.title: Firebase Codelabs (TODO App)
resources_details.desc: In this codelab, you’ll learn how to use the Polymer's <firebase-element> to create a TODO app using Firebase.

resources_details.title: Docker Codelabs (Docker Birthday #3)
resources_details.desc: In this codelab, you’ll will go through the steps involved in running and developing a simple voting app from a fresh computer using the Docker Toolbox.
